abstract.p: Garfield DeMarco, prominent South Jersey Republican and cranberry grower, settles claim brought by state that he illegally disturbed 22 acres of wetlands without permit; agrees to donate 74 acres in Woodland Township to state, grant easement for recreation trail and prserve 591 acres in their natural state (S)

block.p: A prominent South Jersey Republican who is one of 47 cranberry growers in the state has agreed some of his property in Woodland Township, Burlington County. Garfield DeMarco made the agreement in settlement of a claim brought by the state Department of Environmental Protection that he illegally disturbed 22 acres of wetlands without a permit. He has agreed to donate 74 acres of land to the state, grant an easement across his property for a recreation trail, and preserve another 591 acres in its natural state.

A prominent South Jersey Republican who is one of 47 cranberry growers in the state has agreed some of his property in Woodland Township, Burlington County. He has agreed to donate 74 acres of land to the state, grant an easement across his property for a recreation trail, and preserve another 591 acres in its natural state.
